website_summaries.verdict: A solid, comfortable belt, but others have a better design and more reliable quality.
pros: Thick and rugged leather design with no-slip suede interior lining and secure stitching throughout
cons: Larger individuals may prefer a wider belt
The 2-prong buckle is more difficult to adjust than other types of closures

customer_reviews.title: Great support, just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this belt for the past couple months and it works perfectly. At first I ordered a small and I had it on the last notch so I exchanged it for a medium .. but turns out I was wearing it WAY to lose so now it's on the tightest one. Moral of the story is look into how tight you're supposed to have them and everything will work out:)
customer_reviews.author: Danielle C

customer_reviews.title: Do your back a favor and get this belt
customer_reviews.text: I have been an avid gym rat for many years. Although I am not a power lifter, I do enjoy lifting pretty heavy like one. Over the years, I have developed some back problems from this heavy lifting due to poor form when fatigued. Using smaller, starter gym belts just don't cut it when you are squatting 400-500lbs plus. I realized I needed a "real" lifting belt at that point. Enter this baby. It keeps your core very sturdy with it's thick, sturdy build. If you want to lift heavy, this belt will definitely fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a belt!
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid piece of equipment. I have used a bunch of belts of all different styles, and this one is certainly my favorite. When squatting heavy, this gives you something substantial to push against and you focus on the lift rather than belt insecurity. The leather is nice and stiff and just about has the elasticity of a piece of iron. Perfect. I just got the belt and have used it for only a few lifts so far, but I'm not feeling concerned about it's longevity. I'll certainly update this review if I end up having any problems at all. I really don't foresee any issues though...this thing is rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Leviticus Maximus

customer_reviews.title: Preference I suppose
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the construction of the belt. The problem with belts like these are, they're made so tough that they're next to impossible to put on and take off! Belts with hooks need to be bendable. I fought more with getting the belt off after sets than doing an actual workout that I finished the workout belt less. If you get a belt like this, make sure it has a latch instead. Your life will be much easier
customer_reviews.author: James R

customer_reviews.title: Great Belt
customer_reviews.text: This was significantly less expensive than other belts I looked at, but I've had it for about a year now and it provides the support I want for heavy squats and shows no signs of breaking down any time soon. I was concerned about the rivets and the buckle, but they are as solid as I've seen. It's thick enough to provide robust support, but thin enough I really didn't have to break it in like slightly thicker belts. I would definitely buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, bad. How did this 4.4 stars!?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this belt b/c it had good reviews but it is a bad belt! It is as stiff as a board. It felt like it was crushing my kidneys since it wants to stay a cylinder shape and didn't form to my waist. Also it's impossible to slip the strap into the loop after buckled. I have a 33"-36" waist so I bought a medium and it fit on the very last notch. I've used good belts, this one is not acceptable! Dog collars are made better!
customer_reviews.author: The DL

customer_reviews.title: Can you say Anxiety?!
customer_reviews.text: Stiff af, super hard to get on and even harder to get off! I almost got anxiety after my set because I was exhausted from the set, sweating and couldn’t get the belt off. My husband had to help me and I almost lost it!! This happened each time after use. We rolled it, we used weights to “break it in” but nothing helped. It’s very hard to get on and off. Sadly time to try yet another
customer_reviews.author: Wonder Woman

customer_reviews.title: Medicore at best
customer_reviews.text: It's thick and I'm sure it will provide support but the hardware is very, very lightweight. I doubt the hardware will last very long. Also I suggest listening to the experts and avoiding a two prong belt altogether. It's a real hassle trying to get BOTH holes lined up.
customer_reviews.author: B. Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Great belt
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid well made belt. It's sturdy and works great for me. I've received complements and questions about it since I started using it. My only complaint is that the rivets were slightly corroded when I recieved the belt. This is not an issue in the short term and I doubt it will be over the life of the belt. I definitely recommend this belt.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Solid lifting belt but hard to get on and off.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this belt is amazing and once you can get it on it gives top notch support, very much as advertised. The only draw back which was a big one for me is getting it on tight enough and then trying to get it off. The belt is very thick so getting it tight enough to get the prongs in is a challenge. Then when you wanna take it off it's almost like another workout to get the prongs out, they needed to be curved a little more I think. If you don't mind fighting with it then it's a great belt, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse M.

customer_reviews.title: pretty good belt but i like to cinch my belts ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty good belt but i like to cinch my belts tight when i lift heavy. i ordered a size medium based on the size chart and it's still slightly to big. my measurement was around 31". will more than likely just punch additional holes into it eventually instead of returning it. also, if you care about these things, the leather isn't 1 solid piece, it's 2 pieces pressed and sandwiched between the exterior. i'm 5'4" w/ a short torso so it is slightly uncomfortable but that's probably due to me not being able to tighten it more to keep it from slouching down.
customer_reviews.author: wyllis chu

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent belt
customer_reviews.text: I've been lifting for over 8 years and have always used a Valeo belt. Never really thought a belt could make a drastic difference. This belt is far and away superior and the best I've used. It's uniform all around, nice and sturdy and it gives a nice, solid feedback when I push my belly full of air against the belt to create intra-abdominal pressure. I also found the sizing to be accurate. All in all, an excellent belt, especially for the people who have been using cheaper belts in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Lem Kuda "Big"

customer_reviews.title: Excellent powerlifting belt. Great value for the dollar.
customer_reviews.text: A very serious powerlifting belt. VERY stiff which is what is needed, but the two pronged buckle makes it difficult to properly put on or take off until it is extremely well broken in. This is actually the proper sort of belt to use for heavy deadlifts and squats. Be very, very careful about measuring for fit. Make sure you know exactly where to measure, as it should ride higher than a normal pants belt. That being said, there is plenty of length and if you are relatively trim, the fit should be easy: 36-38" mid section will be LARGE, although the temptation will be to chose Xtra large.
customer_reviews.author: Roger M. Woodbury

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap alternative to the more expensive belts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a temporary belt since I was waiting for my leather belt to come in. It is good for what it is ( I like my leather belt a lot better). It was a bit tough in the beginning and took a while to break it in. My deadlifts have become stable ever since using a belt. This is a good cheap alternative to the more expensive belts but nothing can beat the feel and quality of the leather weightlifting belts.
customer_reviews.author: axsolorz

customer_reviews.title: Great quality belt
customer_reviews.text: I've used this brand of belt for years in a different size but have since outgrown it. I bought a new one in a larger size and it fits/feels great. You definitely need to break in the belt though adequately before using. I suggest rolling it out several times in both directions to help break in the material a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: for the price does the damn job!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is tough, looks like it will last me years and for the price thats all I ask of it. I use it in a super hot garage gym (which means alot of sweat) ,wear it super tight and after 2 mos of use, (roughly 20-30 days) it still hasnt broken in!! tough belt! I really like the width of the belt you feel like you get full protection a solid feel from it. I have a bad lower back and this thing has allowed me to lift like ive had in my younger years without holding back....did I really say younger years!??
customer_reviews.author: Freddi Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Belt!
customer_reviews.text: This belt is Awesome! Being a weightlifter for 30 plus years I have had "a few" weight belts in my time. This is by far the best I have ever had. Its thin but that allows it to conform to your body better than the super thick and stiff belts. You think "thin? That's not going to support you under heavy weight". It Does! Great belt and I will tell friends and buy more to keep in my closet (for down the road).
customer_reviews.author: frown

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: excellent for squats and deadlifts over 225lbs. 4 stitches and thick leather will help keep your back supported. After 30 years of squats and lifting heavier weights I can definately recommend.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised, the belt feels supportive even with heavy weight on squats and deadlifts for example. The material seems like it will last a long time and is very durable. I'm a pretty wide bodied guy so I got the XXL it's actually almost to big I'm on the last holes and I could go tighter but for now it fits fine. Might look into a way to make more holes or I'll have to get smaller size. Overall I'm very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: price point vs quality
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months now. Quality is great and feels very good when doing heavy squats. I like to keep it on in relatively loose position between sets or other exercises that don't require a tight fit because it feels good.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: the loop to tuck in the tail of the belt is too close to the buckle to be useful. Also
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers have correctly identified the problems with this belt. While the belt had sufficient adjustment, the loop to tuck in the tail of the belt is too close to the buckle to be useful. Also, compared to the adjustment resolution of Velcro belts, the double tang buckle is just inferior. The build quality of this belt, and the poor quality of the rivets don't justify the $50 price.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: great weight lifting belt
customer_reviews.text: I love this belt! I use it weightlifting and I couldn't feel more confident and secure. I am a 5'10" female, 155 lbs. This does the trick. I had to run it over with my car a few times to break it in. I recommend this!! *do not run over hardware*
customer_reviews.author: Miranda L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great belt! I've owned this belt and have used ...
customer_reviews.text: Great belt! I've owned this belt and have used it 2-3 times a week for 5 years now and it's just as good as it was on the first day. The leather quality and stitching is good and hasn't given in at all as it does on some of the cheaper belts you find at the retail stores. If you're looking for one belt to serve all your needs for years to come, buy this belt!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: Take the time to measure yourself around your waist on the outside if your workout clothes and you will not be unhappy about the size at all. I had a similar belt 20 years ago so I knew what to expect as I am getting back into shape.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie S

customer_reviews.title: Cheap in quality as well as price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I wanted an economical belt for my kids that was on par with higher end belts but without the higher end cost. But this is no where near the quality of an Inzer or Titan belt. It's really light and thin, definitely not 13mm thick and the buckle seems pretty cheap . As my kids are currently only squatting and deadlifting in the 225 to 300 lbs. range, I hope it lasts at least a couple years. Spend the extra $$$ and get a high quality belt from a better source.
customer_reviews.author: P'Dog

customer_reviews.title: Good quality belt, heavy duty, make sure you want a double prong vs single prong belt
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to get on and off with the double prongs but the quality is very good and it's very heavy duty. Husband says he's prefer the single prong belt after using this one for a while. When it's on the leather is so thick that after a heavy set it's hard to get off quickly if needed.
customer_reviews.author: RennLaRoux

customer_reviews.title: Great support, comfortable, wish I could have found a single prong buckle
customer_reviews.text: Belt works great, fits as expected and has enough support for heavy squats and deadlifts without being cumbersome or uncomfortable. Would recommend this hands down over any cheap tapered alternative. Seem like it will last a while, but only time will tell.. thus the 4 star rating. I also wish I could have found this belt with a single prong, they are just slightly easier to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: C. V.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome belt for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy since buying this belt. Others I had tried in the same price range were cheaply made and very stiff and uncomfortable. This belt is flexible enough to move with your body, but sturdy enough to support you in heavy squats and deadlifts. I've been using this two or three days a week for over 3 months now and there's almost no signs of wear on the belt. Just a little divet and slight wear in the holes I tighten it up too
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm short waisted and needed to know whether I could wear a 4 inch belt, and this seemed an inexpensive way to find out. It's about what I expected for the price. Would rather have a single tongue on the buckle. It's pretty stiff when new and requires some breaking in, and I took a very sharp knife and eased the edges on the inside of the belt so it didn't dig into my ribs and hipbones so much. Overall, a good buy. Eventually, I'll probably buy a better belt, but this one does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Richwine

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: The only that sucks about this belt is the break in but other than that it does what it needs to and its definitely sturdy wont break on during the lift
customer_reviews.author: Gomez

customer_reviews.title: This is a professional Olympic grade weight/powerlifting belt. You ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a professional Olympic grade weight/powerlifting belt. You should only go for this one if you're serious about your weights. The belt is very well made, feels strong and safe, it is a bit stiff though but you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a friend and it was the wrong size. They were great about returning me my money and I reordered the proper size. Shipped in a long box so the leather doesn't get been which is great! Happy they took such great care with the shipping. I can't say about the product since I don't use it myself. I didn't get any complaints though and he says it works great and offer more support than the cheaper velcro brands.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bang for your buck !!
customer_reviews.text: I've been in the gym many years. I owned some belts in the past over twice the price of this one. They were great belts, but so is this one. Why waste the money. This thing is Heavy Duty. Don't expect the feeling of soft fur around your belly. This is a powerlifting belt. Its gonna bite a bit, but offers great support. So glad I got this !
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Have not used it for real heavy lifting ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have not used it for real heavy lifting yet, but will be working threw my power cycle. Should be the determination of how well it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Schwartz/Young

customer_reviews.title: Solid Belt, Better Price
customer_reviews.text: Good belt for the price, especially for those looking for their first REAL weight belt. Definitely has a break-in period and will likely be stiffer than new lifters expect but it works well. Build quality is solid though the tip of my belt has been fraying. Not too many complaints when it serves its purpose for bargain level pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion they are the best. I got one that may be a little ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always used this in the gym and now i finally have one. In my opinion they are the best. I got one that may be a little too big but that's ok because I fluctuate weight allot because i eat out too much and i can just punch a hole in it myself for another size.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Solid belt...better than most lever belts
customer_reviews.text: This belt is solid. I have a lever belt where the excess (that material that goes through the belt loop when you tighten it up) is on the inside and it is uncomfortable as hell. THIS belt is a 4" all the way around and works for me when I do heavy squats or shrugs. It is thick and I'd expect years of use. The only reason I had to buy this one was because someone stole the one I had before this...which was identical. The dyes don't wear off on your shirt, fyi. I have zero complaints. Now...go get yoked up!
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: I was recommended this belt and now I fully recommend this belt
customer_reviews.text: Since using this belt I never squat or deadlift without it, this belt keeps pressure up against my abdominal wall and my lower to mid back. I was recommended this belt and now I fully recommend this belt, its great material and does NOT fall apart. when doing your sizing make sure you know what you are measuring
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is what a weightlifting belt should be.
customer_reviews.text: This belt is what the books are telling you to get when they say to get a weightlifting belt. It's wide enough to cover most of the abdominal region, and thick enough to provide a strong foundation for you to clench your abs against. It's not much to look at, but who cares? It does the job, and it's built solidly enough to keep doing the job for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Doggerel

customer_reviews.title: Great belt for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Use this at least 3x a week with lifting, and it offers perfect support and hasn't showed any signs of fray or tearing. Slightly tougher on a shorter torso, but so much better then others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: JTess

customer_reviews.title: amazing belt
customer_reviews.text: i use this belt every day i do squats/ deadlift and this belt just gets more and more comfortable. make sure to break it in before first use and you'll love this belt!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Great for deadlifts!
customer_reviews.text: The minute I put this belt on I felt more secure and stable. It helped my squats and deadlifts a LOT. It's stiff, and it pinches a bit, but it provides such excellent support that I don't care. I feel like if it were less stiff it wouldn't work as well. Especially on deadlifts - helped me break my PR with no problem, and feel safer doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Merry

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: very good belt, but does require a solid breaking in.
customer_reviews.author: Freeman Axtell

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: 6' 220lbs. Slight gut, I use the 2nd from first perforations, could go to 3rd set but not worth the discomfort. If I lost some weight around the middlevI could still use this easily. If you are 6'+ and have a gut that goes to or past your toes, the medium is likely too small. Does the job its supposed to well.
customer_reviews.author: poopscoop

customer_reviews.title: Great support for Power Lifting!
customer_reviews.text: Had a few belts prior but none gave me the support needed for the heavier deadlifts and squats. This belt is solid construction and has a lot of adjustment holes to suit different tightness needs. I can't say enough about this belt! Great addition for and serious lifters and really great for those power lifts!
customer_reviews.author: BKL

customer_reviews.title: way too big
customer_reviews.text: im 41" around the belly the xlarge says for 38-45 so thats what i ordered it will not tighten down enough to even use its so big. sending back to get a large. looks like a good sturdy belt though
customer_reviews.author: Dizzy Wizzle

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected for price.
customer_reviews.text: Great belt. Bought the large (My waist is 33) and I always use the last set of holes on the belt. Cut it close, but it ends up fitting perfectly. If you would rather not use the last set of holes, I'd opt for a medium. About 1 week after I bought it, one of the buttons that holds the roller broke off. Since then I have had no problems and I am satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Biesack

customer_reviews.title: Just like other belts but cheaper
customer_reviews.text: This is a bona fide powerlifting belt. I confidently pull 400+ pounds wearing it and can say it is high quality and will not let you down, just hang it when you're done don't step on it. It's thick y'all. I'm a 36 waist and got a large. I'm on the second to last holes.
customer_reviews.author: BruteStrong

customer_reviews.title: Although I find the belt would fit best between 2 of the existing holes
customer_reviews.text: 180lbs, 5'10", 32" waist. Medium works for me. Although I find the belt would fit best between 2 of the existing holes. I'm considering drilling holes myself but am worried it would go wrong. Anyone made custom holes? The belt is thick and high quality. Stiff though and the end sometimes pokes out and hits my arms when I'm doing certain lifts. Regardless, it's pretty awesome and helpful when you're loaded up on weight.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Potter

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoyed this belt
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this on March 17th and received it as promised on March 19th. I waited to long to get a belt and settled on getting this one because it was the only one that would come in time for my meet on March 21st. I just want to say, this belt was a very pleasant surprise. I hit pr's on all 3 lifts and toppled my goal of hitting 1000 lb on my first meet. I really enjoyed this belt. Just make sure to break it in a bit before using it
customer_reviews.author: jim bob

customer_reviews.title: Good Belt, Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a competitive lifter, but I'm in the gym often, and doing my squats and deadlifts at least once a week (for each). And this belt works Very Well for me. Easily recommend it to an avid fellow gym enthusiast. The ONLY thing I'd caution against is that, like most new belts (I'm told) this model digs into you like a mofo in the beginning. I did take the advice from another post and put sandpaper to the edges (where my front hipbones hit and mid lower back) and that helped a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Leather Power Weight Lifting Belt-4" Black
customer_reviews.text: Solid, high quality, and appears to be made for long use leather power lifting belt. The belt is very stiff at first, but that is more a result of the solid construction. This belt definitely gets my recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: chammeek

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: well made but I am a power lifter and too tight on my back started to get spasms
customer_reviews.author: Tony NYC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing belt
customer_reviews.text: Amazing belt for heavy weight training. Once this belt is broken in it does it job compared to Walmart belts . Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: As with a lot of leather weightlifting belts, this one was SUPER stiff when I took it out of the box. I've loosened it up quite a bit but it's still pretty tight. The sizing recommendations were pretty spot on for me. I only wish there were holes between holes - the 3rd holes are a bit too tight, the 4th holes are a bit too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Cowgill

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid weightlifting belt, been using it for about a year now, no problems to speak of.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Lewis

customer_reviews.title: but it has been great for me
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction. I'm not setting records by any stretch of the imagination, but it has been great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Great Value.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastically constructed belt. Not at all like the garbage at sporting good stores. Keep in mind this is not worn around your hips as much as your true waist. I wear a size 38 jean and I needed to get an XL to fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The tip of the leather is coming apart after two uses. UPDATE: Quite disappointed; the stitching is now coming apart. I've been very careful since the initial wear on the leather after just the first few uses, and yet still the belt is falling apart after a month of use. Regretting this purchase as I will have to upgrade to a more expensive option soon.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Un

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty belt!
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty belt really legit, I had a valero belt for the longest time with the 6inch back I decided to order this belt because of the price and great reviews this belt really opened my eyes and made me realize the quality and performance between the belts this belt is built to last
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great belt!
customer_reviews.text: This belt is great. It’s really sturdy, and thick. Not flimsy like some of the other so-called lifting belts. This is the second one that I’ve actually had to purchase, because some thief at my Gym stole mine in between sets!
customer_reviews.author: Tyshawn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Its finally loosening up
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Its finally loosening up! I have to say though I think the measurements might be wrong because I ordered according to my waist size and it barely fits on the last belt hole. I kept it in hopes I will lose some weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Yost

customer_reviews.title: Great value!!
customer_reviews.text: This belt had deadlifted so many things and saved my lower bak many times. The buckle works well and the belt has gotten way softer and this great is a fantastic value!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the lifter
customer_reviews.text: This belt definitely works well for my lifting purposes. I use it for low-bar squats, deadlifts, standing barbell shoulder press, and bent-over barbell rows. It's wide enough to give you the necessary support, sturdy enough, and comfortable enough to not dig into your flesh. Definitely a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gun Grabbing Memes

customer_reviews.title: Solid Belt
customer_reviews.text: Very solid belt, I've been using this with squats, overhead presses, and bench pressing without any issues. The belt does require a breaking in period, and I found that after the belt started to get broken in more, I went from the first pair of notches to the second. The one thing I disagree with is the sizing: my dress belt size is a 36, so when I went to order a large (because it recommended ordering a size 3"-6" longer than your dress belt), I found it to be way too big, and a medium size to be just right.
customer_reviews.author: Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to Inzer. Made well.
customer_reviews.text: Very good belt for the money. Time will tell how long it holds up. For less than half of an Inzer or Best belt and to get it in 2 days instead of 8 weeks, it was worth the risk. Used heavily 3x a week for the last month and it hasn't shown any wear as of yet. I really wish they'd make a single prong. That's the only reason I'm not giving it a full 5.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I feel so safe when lifting (squatting, dead lifts, Olympic lifts) with this belt. It is on the heavy side but that is what you want. Just like a bullet proof vest, I would prefer it heavier if it does the job right.
customer_reviews.author: Nick j

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 2 months time.
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this belt because my previous belt of 8 years finally gave in. I purchased this belt expecting the kind of high quality that would last. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the leather upon arrival. However, after 2 months of use the weld on the belt buckle BROKE making the belt worthless. The company only accepts returns within the first 30 days. Please do let my warning go unheard and save yourself some trouble. Purchase another belt.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sterling

customer_reviews.title: Great powerlifting belt with a nice wide band and provides ...
customer_reviews.text: Great powerlifting belt with a nice wide band and provides solid support for lifts. I have a 29" waist (5'6" female) and the small belt fits at the third set of holes in for fit reference. It is very stiff when you first get it and so can be a little difficult to tighten but breaks in after a few months. I have several friends who have this same belt and love it!
customer_reviews.author: Vidaxylia

customer_reviews.title: The belt that fell apart on me
customer_reviews.text: Great belt, only had this belt for a year though. Besides the color bleeding onto my clothes (I do sweat a decent amount during my workouts) I enjoyed it until the buckle started to rust and the metal studs that kept the belt together broke apart and the..... Well this belt basically fell apart on me now that I think of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: I would pass on this.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a giant piece of leather. I almost had to have it cut off of me because putting it tight made it almost impossible to get back off. The good part is that there isn’t a chance it’s going to break on you.
customer_reviews.author: Romeo bravo

customer_reviews.title: These are the legit thing. Not the skinny ones
customer_reviews.text: I competed powerlifting in highschool. These are what we used. It will be a little stiff roll it around and some sweat is needed to help loosen it up.
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: I had to return this because it was smaller than ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this because it was smaller than I expected for a large (I'm 38"-40") but more notably was how hard it was to unbuckle this and not because it was tight, The two prongs were too long and hard to unbuckle.
customer_reviews.author: smartshopper9912

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: My waist measures 33.5, so I went ahead and ordered the medium. The belt is to be worn tight in order to perform its function. With that said, I'm on the second to last hole when I tighten down on it. Moreover, the belt feels like it's made out of cardboard instead of solid leather - solid leather belts don't come apart in layers when you peel back the edges. I'm looking for a competition belt, so I think I will go ahead and dish out $40 more and get a product that will last me years.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: My lifting has greatly improved thanks to this belt!
customer_reviews.text: First I will say that I can be a pretty critical reviewer. I tend to never give 5 stars unless I am extremely impressed with a product. Overall I have no complaints at all. On some days I wish that I had gotten a belt that was as tall. Perhaps a 3 inch belt rather than a 4 inch belt. I am 5'7", 176lb male. Mesomorph build. This belt was a size small, and I've got one set of notches left before I would need to buy a medium sized belt. Possible product improvements: Ship the belts already broken-in... that's really the only improvement I can think of. It's a great belt, however.
customer_reviews.author: jamesh53

customer_reviews.title: Good belt, solid support
customer_reviews.text: This belt replaces a Nike Velcro. Buckle is definitely way better and the thickness of the belt is great. I only used it a few times, but looks like it can hold for a while. This belt doesn't necessarily need much of break-in so can be used on day of delivery. I like the abdomen support with the 4" all around.
customer_reviews.author: @bashar

customer_reviews.title: NOT SAFE!!! Beware :(
customer_reviews.text: i am so disappointed in this product. I have had it hardly two months and considering i only use it once a week for one exercise (squats) i can't believe the buttons are popping off. Buyers beware, i am glad i spotted the missing buttons because this could have popped in half mid lift and could have caused me some serious injuries...Scary stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Solid great value
customer_reviews.text: Waist 38 got a size large. Sturdy, good material, thick, good support.
customer_reviews.author: online spending

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be synthetic leather but otherwise should work fine. The few times I used it worked well ...
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be synthetic leather but otherwise should work fine. The few times I used it worked well and stayed stiff. Not sure if it will last as long as a genuine leather belt. For the price feel it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sanfelippo

customer_reviews.title: This belt is heavy duty and excellent quality. One of the best belts i bought ...
customer_reviews.text: This belt is heavy duty and excellent quality. One of the best belts i bought in years. I received it earlier than i expected.
customer_reviews.author: Tavita & Falicia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic feeling
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'3" 250 lb. This feels fantastic on my core when squatting. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Guj Mil

customer_reviews.title: Bad ass belt
customer_reviews.text: Bad ass belt. Very stiff great support. Good price. Hard to get on and off for the first few weeks, but that's normal for a thick belt. One year later of 3x a week of heavy lifting it's still holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mane

customer_reviews.title: feels comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: feels comfortable and supportive. does its job. however, the belt is so stiff that breaking it in is extremely difficult. I had a hard time taking the belt off the first time I tried it on. also, the box was delivered with all the tape/box ripped open like someone deliberately took a look inside but I have no idea how that occurred. just an FYI, the belt showed up fine.
customer_reviews.author: gdum

customer_reviews.title: Solid belt
customer_reviews.text: I've had this belt for about two years and it was one of the best investments I have made in weightlifting next to chalk. if you can handle breaking it in then you will love it but when you first get this thing it will be very stiff. give it some times and break it in before you start pushing the weight.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel

customer_reviews.title: As good as the more expensive powerlifting belts.
customer_reviews.text: Was going to order an expensive Titan belt - they were on backorder. I needed something sooner. I ordered this belt and I've been using it sense - no need to order a Titan anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: AskNick

customer_reviews.title: Power Lifting belt
customer_reviews.text: Very nice belt for the price. I was pleasantly suprised. But the Large belt will fit a small to medium waistline. It was 4" too short for me. Looking at the specs it was suposed to fit. Ordered a XXL and it barely fit my 40" waist... Walt
customer_reviews.author: Walter Dudley

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done - its sturdy and once broke in after a few wears it ...
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done - its sturdy and once broke in after a few wears it feels fine - but the two prongs make it more difficult to get off than its single prong counterparts (hard enough to cause a bit of a struggle after a set of heavy deadlifts, which is frustrating). As with another review I saw, the threading has already started to come undone a bit, nothing crazy or that affects its performance, just a little disappointing given ive only had it for a month and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this belt for squatting, and deadlifting for almost a year, anywhere from there times to five times a week, little to no wear. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ZanyCactus

customer_reviews.title: been using it for a while and it is PAINFUL to use
customer_reviews.text: I waited to write this review in the hopes that the belt would eventually break in. No such luck, been using it for a while and it is PAINFUL to use. I previously had a Schieck belt which gave me no problems, but this one digs into my skin and bones and is hurting me when squatting and deadlifting. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Yair Shafir

customer_reviews.title: if you weight lift, should seriously getting this
customer_reviews.text: I have this new belt which replaced my old, flimsy weight belt for more than 6 months. This is one tuff and yet at the same time feel good belt, My advice to others purchase a weight belt similar to this, is expect to break it in by wearing it around the house for several hours.
customer_reviews.author: Pereeli

customer_reviews.title: Provides Excellent Stability and Support Tends to slide upward into my ...
customer_reviews.text: Provides Excellent Stability and Support Tends to slide upward into my midsection while performing squats because it does not exactly fit my body I have a slender build Time to look for a Leather Drill Bit to get it to FIT Tight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good abdomen protection
customer_reviews.text: Never had a belt with the full 4" all around the belt. It makes a huge difference and I feel well protected across my lower abdomen against herniating. I like this belt.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick C. Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Great belt!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This belt has INCREDIBLE support. But be warned, I have a 34 inch waste and ordered a large and I use the very last belt loop. This thing is freakin huge. Might actually be bullet proof. And is super stiff out the gate. But I can already tell this belt will out live me. It's tough enough to tow your car. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent belt. Sturdy, good looking, supportive. I've been lifting for about 8 years now, and this is the first power lifting belt I've used. I only used Olympic style belts before, and this is definitely better for deads and squats.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle McKanna

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this belt for two months while training for my first powerlifting meet. It is very durable and provides great support. It also met the criteria to be used in the powerlifting meet.
customer_reviews.author: AmericanPride

customer_reviews.title: Some of the pain was due to bad form. This belt keeps things in place and ...
customer_reviews.text: Provides maximum protection for my squats and deadlifts. Well worth the money because I kept hurting my lower back. Some of the pain was due to bad form. This belt keeps things in place and tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seemed pretty sturdy, though
customer_reviews.text: Got the medium based on my own waist measurements and the measurements of the belt in the description. Maybe I was shipped a small instead of a medium in error? The belt I received was too small, so I returned it. Seemed pretty sturdy, though.
customer_reviews.author: katro

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness purchase made in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Best fitness purchase made in a long time. Saves my back from tight spinal erector muscles which could cause injury
customer_reviews.author: Bjorn Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a serious weightlifting belt for the serious lifter. Super wide, supports your entire lower back. Don't buy a cheapie and have to buy another one in a couple years. This one will last you a lifetime and then you can pass it on to your kids!
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Seems pretty resistant
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Seems pretty resistant, I wore it about 25 times so far and it shows no sign of wear. Only minor issue is the holes are tight and it can be hard to put on or take off. I'd still buy it, given the chance...
customer_reviews.author: Carl

product_meta.title: Ader Leather Power Lifting Weight Belt- 4" Black
product_meta.description: Weightlifting belts are useful for reducing stress on your back and keeping your posture stable/upright while you lift to help prevent hyper extension. Ship out in 2-7 days. XXXL: TOTAL LENGTH : 57 3/4 , EFECTIVE SIZE : 42" - 51" XXL: TOTAL LENGTH : 53 1/2 " , EFECTIVE SIZE:40 1/4 - 47 1/4" XL: TOTAL LENGTH : 51" , EFECTIVE SIZE:38" - 45" L: TOTAL LENGTH: 47 1/2" , EFECTIVE SIZE : 34" - 41" M: TOTAL LENGTH : 44" , EFECTIVE SIZE:30 1/4" - 37 1/4" S: TOTAL LENGTH : 40" , EFECTIVE SIZE:26 3/4 -33 3/4" XS: TOTAL LENGTH: 36", EFECTIVE SIZE:22 3/4" - 29 3/4"
feature_bullets: The easy to use closure system features a double-prong seamless roller buckle with a single loop to secure belt tab
These belts are made of very durable leather and may require some breaking in.
